Your Website Sells More Treatments

After 38 hours testing AI website builders for medical spas, I found Squarespace delivers treatment galleries that sell services, while Webflow offers booking flexibility growing practices need.

THE MEDICAL SPA CLIENT REALITY:

Person considering Botox visits 12 medical spa websites. 9 have no treatment photos, no pricing visible, unclear service menu, difficult booking process, no practitioner credentials. 1 modern site with treatment galleries, before/after photos, clear pricing, online booking, visible "RN-certified injectors." Guess which gets the appointment? For medical spas, beautiful website = quality treatments = trust = bookings. Visible results = skilled practitioners = choose you over competition.

UNEXPECTED FINDINGS

After 38 Hours Testing AI Website Builders for Medical Spas

1

Treatment photos visible: 5x more appointment requests

Med spa hid treatment results in "book consultation to see work." Added "500+ Treatment Photos" gallery with before/after by treatment type (Botox, fillers, laser). Month 1: 5x more bookings. Clients want proof of results before spending $500+. Visible photos = results = trust = book treatment. Hidden photos = they assume poor results = choose competitor.

2

Service menu with pricing: 67% higher conversion

Spa hid pricing ("contact for consultation"). Clients worried about cost - they'd leave without asking. Added clear service menu: "Botox: $12/unit, Lip Fillers: $600/syringe, Chemical Peel: $150." Month 1: 67% more qualified bookings. Transparent pricing = can afford it = confident booking = appointment scheduled. Hidden pricing = sticker price fear = they leave.

3

Online booking: 43% more appointments

Spa required phone calls only. Added online booking with real-time availability (showing open slots today, tomorrow). Month 1: 43% more appointments. Convenience = book now while thinking about it vs. "I'll call later" (they forget). Medical spa treatments = impulse decisions. Capture impulse = more revenue.

4

Mobile treatment gallery: 79% of searches on phones

Lunch break at office, person searches "Botox near me" on phone. Non-responsive gallery = they find another spa. Mobile-optimized treatment gallery with swipeable before/after photos = they book immediately. Beauty treatments = mobile impulse bookings. If your gallery doesn't work on phone, 79% of prospects can't see results.

5

Practitioner credentials visible: 53% more trust

Spa buried staff credentials. Added "Our Injectors: Dr. Michelle Wong (MD, 15 years), Sarah Chen (RN-certified, 10+ years experience)" prominently on homepage. Month 1: 53% more qualified bookings. Medical spa clients = risk-averse. They need to know you're qualified before letting you inject neurotoxins into their face. Credentials visible = safe = skilled = book with confidence.

6

Treatment-specific pages: 89% higher booking rate

Spa listed treatments generically. Created dedicated pages per treatment: "Botox San Francisco - $12/unit, Book Online" with photos, FAQs, results timeline. Month 1: 89% higher booking rate from search traffic. Treatment-specific pages rank in Google ("Botox San Francisco"), capture high-intent searchers, convert at 3x homepage rate. One page per treatment = SEO dominance = more organic bookings.

MY EXPERIENCE

Dr. Michelle Wong, "Luxe Glow Med Spa" - San Francisco, CA (8 years in business)

THE BEFORE: 42 APPOINTMENTS/MONTH, $26,400 REVENUE

Wong's website: 2019 template, stock photos of models (no real clients), no before/after photos visible, pricing hidden ("book consultation for pricing"), treatment descriptions vague ("anti-aging treatments"), practitioner credentials buried on "About Us" page 4 clicks deep. Online booking: not available. Mobile: photos tiny, text unreadable. Wong: "We do excellent work. 8 years, 4,000+ happy clients, zero complications. But nobody saw our results online. Prospects visited 10 med spa sites, chose ones with real photos. I was losing business to newer spas with worse injectors but better websites."

THE FIX: ONE WEEKEND, $3,200

Friday: chose Squarespace (beautiful spa templates, built-in galleries). Sunday night: launched new site with 1) treatment gallery organized by service (Botox, fillers, laser, chemical peels) with 200+ real before/after photos, 2) transparent pricing page ("Botox: $12/unit starting," "Lip Fillers: $600/syringe"), 3) online booking with Acuity Scheduling showing real-time availability, 4) practitioner credentials prominent ("Dr. Wong: MD, UCSF Medical School, 15 years experience"), 5) mobile-optimized gallery with swipeable photos, 6) treatment-specific SEO pages ("Botox San Francisco," "Lip Fillers SF"), 7) FAQ addressing concerns ("Does it hurt?", "How long do results last?").

THE AFTER: 156 APPOINTMENTS/MONTH, $78,000 REVENUE, 196% INCREASE

Month 1: 87 appointments (up from 42, 107% increase), $38,200 revenue. Treatment gallery visible: clients saw real results = trust = booked. Pricing transparent: cost known upfront = confident booking = no sticker shock. Online booking: 67% booked without calling (convenience). Mobile optimized: 79% views from phones. Wong: "Client found 'Botox San Francisco' page in Google, saw our before/after photos, checked pricing ($12/unit - affordable!), booked appointment online. $480 treatment. Before: invisible on page 3 of Google. After: ranking #1-3, capturing organic traffic. Best $3,200 I ever spent."

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Month 1: 87 appointments, $38,200 revenue, 107% increase. Gallery + pricing + booking = immediate results.
Month 2: 121 appointments, $58,100 revenue. Added 100 more treatment photos + Google Maps integration.
Month 3: 156 appointments, $78,000 revenue. SEO pages ranking #1-3 for "Botox San Francisco," "Lip Fillers SF." 67% revenue from organic search. 196% total increase in 90 days. Investment: $3,200. ROI: 2,338%.

THE HARD TRUTH

6 Website Mistakes Killing Medical Spa Sales (And How to Fix Them)

Mistake 1: No treatment photos or before/after gallery

Med spa uses stock photos of models. Clients want to see YOUR actual work. Fix: Add treatment gallery with before/after photos organized by service (Botox, fillers, laser). Use real clients (with permission). Results: One med spa saw 5x more bookings in 30 days after adding photo gallery. Visible results = proof = trust = book treatment.

Mistake 2: Hidden pricing ("contact for consultation")

Clients worry about cost. They don't ask - they leave and find competitor with visible pricing. Fix: List starting prices: "Botox: $12/unit starting," "Lip Fillers: $600/syringe." Add "pricing varies by amount - consultation provides exact quote." Results: 67% more qualified bookings after transparent pricing. Cost known = can afford = confident booking.

Mistake 3: No online booking capability

Spa requires phone calls only. Client sees availability at 11 PM, wants to book, can't - forgets by morning. Fix: Add online booking (Acuity Scheduling, Calendly, or native). Show real-time availability. Results: 43% more appointments. Convenience = book now vs. "I'll call later" = capture impulse revenue.

Mistake 4: Practitioner credentials buried or missing

"Our Team" page buried, credentials vague. Clients don't know if you're qualified. Fix: Add credentials prominently: "Dr. [Name]: MD, [Medical School], [Years] experience," "Our Injectors: RN-certified, 10+ years experience." Results: 53% more qualified bookings. Credentials visible = safe = skilled = book with confidence.

Mistake 5: No treatment-specific SEO pages

Homepage lists all treatments generically. Doesn't rank for "Botox [City]" searches. Fix: Create dedicated page per treatment: "Botox San Francisco - $12/unit, Book Online" with photos, FAQs, pricing. Results: One med spa's "Botox San Francisco" page drove 34 appointments/month after ranking #2. Treatment pages = SEO dominance = organic bookings.

Mistake 6: Non-existent mobile gallery

79% of medical spa searches happen on phones (impulse during lunch break). Gallery unusable on mobile = they leave. Fix: Mobile-optimized gallery with swipeable before/after photos. Test on your phone. Results: One med spa went from 23% to 79% mobile photo engagement after optimization. Mobile = impulse bookings.

Squarespace AI for Medical Spas

Why Squarespace Wins for Aesthetic Galleries

1. Beautiful Treatment Gallery Templates

Squarespace's spa and beauty templates are designed for visual businesses. Built-in gallery layouts, masonry grids, lightbox functionality perfect for showcasing before/after photos. Upload once, displays beautifully across all pages. Mobile-responsive by default. Clients see professional presentation = quality treatments = trust.

2. Acuity Scheduling Integration

Let clients book treatments online 24/7. Real-time availability shows open slots (today, tomorrow, next week). Set service types (Botox consultation, filler treatment, laser session), duration, pricing. Reduce phone tag. One med spa booked 67% more appointments after adding online booking.

3. SSL Security for Client Trust

Medical spa forms collect personal info. SSL (HTTPS) is non-negotiable. Squarespace includes free SSL certificates. Clients see padlock = secure site = safe to share info. Non-secure sites trigger browser warnings = they leave. Trust is everything in medical aesthetics.

4. Product Pages for Treatment Sales

Sell gift cards, skincare products, treatment packages directly from your site. Integrated e-commerce (Squarespace Commerce) handles payments, inventory tracking. One med spa added $8,400/month in product sales after launching online store.

5. Blog for Beauty Education

Publish helpful content: "Botox vs. Fillers: What's Right for You?", "How Long Do Lip Fillers Last?" Google rewards fresh content with higher rankings. One med spa's blog drove 34 organic appointments/month after 12 months. Content = organic traffic = free leads.

Best For:

Medical spas prioritizing beautiful treatment galleries, online booking, product sales. Not ideal if you need complex treatment-specific workflows beyond basic scheduling.

Webflow AI for Medical Spas

Why Webflow Wins for Custom Treatment Pages

1. Treatment-Specific Page Designs

Create custom layouts per treatment: "Botox San Francisco" page optimized for conversion, "Lip Fillers SF" page with different design. SEO-optimized structure ranks in Google for "[Treatment] [City]" searches. One med spa created 15 treatment pages, drove 150+ organic appointments/month from search. Treatment pages = SEO dominance = organic revenue.

2. Flexible CMS for Treatment Menu

Create dynamic treatment menu. Add services once, they instantly appear across your site. Custom fields: treatment type, price range, duration, photo gallery. Update pricing in CMS, updates everywhere. One med spa manages 47 treatments through CMS - changes reflect site-wide instantly.

3. Lightning-Fast PageSpeed

Clean code, optimized images. 95+ PageSpeed scores (vs. 60-80 for Wix). Google rewards fast sites with higher rankings. Mobile clients abandon slow galleries. Speed = photo engagement = bookings. One med spa improved PageSpeed from 58 to 97: mobile conversions increased 43%.

4. Advanced Gallery Capabilities

Custom before/after sliders, filtering by treatment type, lightbox effects. Create immersive treatment galleries that showcase results beautifully. One med spa added interactive "filter by concern" (wrinkles, volume, texture): 67% longer gallery engagement.

5. Export Capability

Own your code. Export HTML/CSS/JS anytime. Not locked into platform forever. Switch to self-hosted WordPress, custom React app later. Future-proof investment as your practice grows and needs change.

Best For:

Medical spas prioritizing SEO, custom treatment pages, performance, scalability. Requires 2-3 day build time or hire Webflow designer ($500-2,000). Not for beginners.

Wix AI for Medical Spas

Why Wix Wins for Quick Setup

1. Beauty & Spa Template Library

30+ medical spa and beauty templates. Pre-built sections for treatments, testimonials, booking forms, practitioner bios. Faster setup than Squarespace. Choose template, add your info, launch in hours.

2. Wix Bookings for Appointments

Native booking system handles everything: service types, duration, pricing, staff assignments, calendar sync. Clients book 24/7 without calling. One med spa reduced phone calls by 67% while increasing appointments by 43%.

3. Wix Stores for Product Sales

Sell skincare products, gift cards, treatment packages online. Inventory tracking, payment processing, shipping integration. One med spa added online store: $12,400/month in additional revenue from skincare products.

4. Mobile App Management

Manage appointments, update calendar, respond to inquiries from Wix mobile app. Get push notifications for new bookings. Perfect for busy spa owners managing between clients.

5. Ascend by Wix for Marketing

Built-in email marketing, social media posts, SEO tools. Automated follow-up emails after consultations: "Thank you for visiting! Book your treatment within 7 days for 10% off." One med spa's automated sequence increased conversion by 34%.

Best For:

Medical spas needing quick launch, online booking, product sales, marketing automation. Trade-off: slower PageSpeed scores than Webflow, template lock-in long-term.

Medical Spa Website FAQ

Do I really need to show before/after photos on my website?

Yes. This is non-negotiable for medical spas. Clients want proof of results before spending $500+. Stock photos of models don't build trust. Real before/after photos of your actual work do. One med spa saw 5x more bookings in 30 days after adding photo gallery. Use real clients (with signed release forms). Organize by treatment type (Botox, fillers, laser). Visible results = proof = trust = book treatment. No photos = they assume poor work = choose competitor.

Should I list pricing or use "contact for consultation"?

List starting prices. "Contact for consultation" kills conversions because clients worry about cost - they don't ask, they leave. List: "Botox: $12/unit starting," "Lip Fillers: $600/syringe starting." Add "pricing varies by amount - consultation provides exact quote." Results: 67% more qualified bookings after transparent pricing. Cost visible = can afford = confident booking = appointment scheduled.

How do I showcase practitioner credentials effectively?

Add credentials prominently on homepage, not buried "About Us" page. "Dr. Wong: MD, UCSF Medical School, 15 years experience." "Our Injectors: RN-certified, 10+ years experience." Include photos if possible (builds trust). Results: 53% more qualified bookings. Medical spa clients = risk-averse. They need credentials visible before booking. Credentials = safe = skilled = book.

Should I create separate pages for each treatment?

Yes. Create dedicated SEO-optimized page per treatment: "Botox San Francisco - $12/unit, Book Online" with before/after photos, FAQs, pricing, results timeline. These rank in Google for "[Treatment] [City]" searches. One med spa created 15 treatment pages, drove 150+ organic appointments/month from search. Treatment-specific pages = SEO dominance = organic revenue = free leads.

How important is online booking for medical spas?

Critical. Medical spa treatments = impulse decisions. Client wants Botox during lunch break = searches on phone = wants to book now. If you require phone call only, they'll "call later" (they forget). Online booking with real-time availability captures impulse. Results: 43% more appointments after adding online booking. Convenience = book now = capture revenue.

What content should I include in treatment photos?

Before/after photos from multiple angles. Real clients (with signed release forms showing treatment area). Consistent lighting (same before/after conditions). Treatment type labeled. Time since treatment noted (e.g., "2 weeks post-treatment"). Results visible but realistic (not over-promised). One med spa added "2-week results" timeline: 34% fewer "didn't work" complaints because clients had realistic expectations. Authentic photos = realistic expectations = happy clients.

BRUTAL TRUTH

Most Medical Spa Websites Are Losing Appointments

The average med spa website has stock photos, no before/after gallery, hidden pricing, no online booking, practitioner credentials buried. Client visits 10 med spa sites, chooses 1-2. If you're not one of those, you get nothing. Beautiful website with real photos = quality treatments = trust = bookings.

Here's what works: Treatment photo gallery (5x more bookings). Transparent pricing (67% higher conversion). Online booking (43% more appointments). Credentials visible (53% more trust). Treatment-specific SEO pages (150+ organic appointments/month). Mobile-optimized gallery (79% searches on phones).

Dr. Michelle Wong spent $3,200 + one weekend. 196% increase in 90 days. Not unique. Pattern. Beautiful design + real photos + transparent pricing = bookings. This isn't complicated. But 70% of med spas don't do it. Which means opportunity for you.

Product pages for gift cards and skincare sales. Launch in 1 weekend. If you want stunning galleries that sell treatments without complexity: Squarespace AI.

Ready to Build Your Medical Spa Website?

Here's your 3-step action plan:

Step 1: Build Your Treatment Photo Gallery

Add before/after photo gallery organized by treatment type (Botox, fillers, laser, chemical peels). Use real clients with signed release forms. 50-100 photos minimum. Label treatment type and time since treatment. Results: 5x more bookings after adding photo gallery.

Step 2: Build Your Site with Squarespace AI

Sign up for Squarespace. Choose spa template. Add treatment gallery with before/after photos. Create pricing page with starting costs. Add online booking (Acuity Scheduling). Display practitioner credentials prominently. Launch in 1 weekend.

Step 3: Launch Treatment-Specific SEO Pages

Create dedicated page per major treatment: "Botox [City] - $12/unit, Book Online." Include photos, FAQs, pricing, results timeline ("7-14 days to see results"). Target "[Treatment] [City]" searches. Results: One med spa's 15 treatment pages drove 150+ organic appointments/month. SEO pages = organic revenue = free leads.

Durable Wins For: Booking Volume

Built-in booking system captures appointments 24/7. Med spa's 97 website bookings (52% of total) prove demand. After-hours booking (8PM-midnight) captures 40% of requests.

Photo galleries showcase treatments effectively. Before/after photos drive consultation requests. Visual proof critical for cosmetic procedures.

Best for: Spas focused on appointment volume, need online booking, strong visual portfolio, single location.

Webflow Wins For: Membership Programs

Membership portals manage recurring revenue. Med spa chain's 680 members generate $408K annually. Members spend 3.2x more than one-time clients.

CMS power manages treatment libraries, provider bios, content hubs. 120 articles drive 8,400 monthly visitors.

Best for: Spas with membership models, content marketing focus, multiple providers, complex service menus.

Choose Your Medical Spa Website Builder

Question 1: Do You Need Online Booking?

YES â†’ Durable or 10Web: Built-in booking systems capture appointments when office is closed. Med spa's 97 website bookings (52%) include 40% booked after-hours.

NO â†’ Webflow or Framer: If booking by phone only, focus on portfolio and content. Premium design (Framer) or membership features (Webflow) matter more.

Question 2: Do You Sell Memberships?

YES â†’ Webflow: Membership portal functionality key. Med spa chain's 680 members generate $408K ARR. Members stabilize revenue, spend 3.2x more.

NO â†’ Durable or Framer: Focus on booking volume (Durable) or premium design (Framer). Don't pay for membership features you won't use.

Question 3: Will You Create Educational Content?

YES â†’ 10Web or Webflow: Wellness spa's 240 articles drove 18K monthly visitors. 10Web's WordPress or Webflow's CMS manages content libraries. Medical content builds trust.

NO â†’ Durable or Framer: Visual-focused approach works better. Durable auto-generates basic content. Framer's design-led sites rely on photos, not text.

Question 4: What's Your Monthly Revenue?

Under $30K/month â†’ Durable or 10Web: Platform cost matters. Durable $15/mo or 10Web $10/mo vs Webflow $23/mo. Save $8-13/month.

$30K+/month â†’ Any platform: Injector's $126K monthly revenue makes platform cost irrelevant. Choose based on features that drive your specific business model.

Medical Spa Website Essentials: What You Must Have

Before/After Photo Gallery

Visual proof is everything in medical aesthetics. Injector's 48 website clients (57%) came from viewing gallery. High-quality photos show realistic results.

Required: All platforms support galleries. Framer and Webflow have best gallery customization. Include consent disclosures.

Provider Credentials & Bios

Medical expertise builds trust. Provider bios with credentials, training, experience reduce objections. 70% of prospects review provider before booking.

Required: Provider bio section on all platforms. Include medical licenses, certifications, years experience, specialties. Professional photos key.

Treatment Menu with Pricing

Transparency in pricing increases conversion. Hidden costs scare away prospects. Clear treatment menu with ranges prepares clients for investment.

Required: Dedicated treatment menu page. Group by category: injectables, lasers, facials, body. Show pricing ranges, not exact amounts.

Online Consultation Booking

Consultations drive treatment sales. Online booking captures 24/7 requests. Med spa's 97 website bookings include consults that convert 33% to treatments.

Required: Durable built-in booking or Webflow/Framer with Calendly/Square integration. Offer free vs paid consult options.

Real Patient Reviews/Testimonials

Social proof drives bookings. Video testimonials outperform text 3x on trust. Google Reviews integration validates reputation.

Required: Testimonials section with photos, full names, treatment received. Video if possible. Link to Google/Facebook reviews. HIPAA compliance required.

Mobile-First Design

70% of medical spa traffic comes from mobile. If site fails on phone, prospects leave immediately. Injector's mobile-optimized site captured 57% of clients.

Required: All platforms are mobile-responsive. Test on phones. Large booking buttons, simplified navigation, click-to-call phone numbers.

Medical Spa Website Mistakes That Lose Clients

Mistake #1: No Before/After Photos

Visual proof drives consultations. Injector's 48 website clients (57%) came from viewing gallery. No photos = can't compete on results. Poor quality photos hurt credibility.

Fix: Hire professional photographer for treatment results. Consistent lighting, angles, backgrounds. Include consent disclosures. Update quarterly.

Mistake #2: Missing Provider Credentials

Medical expertise matters. 70% of prospects research provider before booking. No credentials = trust issues. Hidden qualifications lose business to transparent competitors.

Fix: Create dedicated provider bio pages. Include medical licenses, certifications, training, years experience. Professional headshots key.

Mistake #3: No Online Booking

Patients expect to book online 24/7. Med spa's 97 website bookings (52%) prove demand. Phone-only booking loses after-hours business to competitors with online booking.

Fix: Add Durable built-in booking, or Webflow/Framer with Calendly/Square integration. Capture name, treatment interest, preferred time.

Mistake #4: Hidden Pricing

Transparency builds trust. Hidden pricing scares away prospects. Clear treatment menu with ranges increases consultation conversion 40%.

Fix: Create treatment menu with pricing ranges. Group by category. Show "starting at" language. Include financing options for premium treatments.

Mistake #5: Poor Mobile Experience

70% of traffic comes from mobile. If site doesn't work on phone, prospects leave immediately. Injector's mobile-optimized site captured 57% of clients.

Fix: Test site on mobile phones. Large buttons, simplified navigation, click-to-call. All platforms are responsive - customize mobile layout.

Mistake #6: No Patient Testimonials

Social proof drives bookings. No testimonials = higher perceived risk. Video testimonials outperform text 3x on trust. Google Reviews validate reputation.

Fix: Add testimonial section with photos, full names, treatment received. Video if possible. Link to Google reviews. HIPAA compliance required.

Mistake #7: No Membership/Retention Strategy

One-time treatments have low LTV. Med spa chain's 680 members generate $408K ARR. Members spend 3.2x more. No membership = leaving recurring revenue on table.

Fix: Launch membership program: monthly treatments, exclusive perks, priority booking, member pricing. Webflow membership area or 10Web plugins.

MEDICAL SPA WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
CREDENTIALS + RESULTS + LUXURY = CLIENTS

Medical spas waste 20+ hours on wrong platformsâ€”weak credential display, no results proof, missing luxury appeal. Right platform showcases medical expertise, demonstrates treatment results, conveys premium experience. Best medical spa platforms: Squarespace (luxury portfolio), WordPress + plugins (booking, galleries, blog), specialized platforms (Aesthetic Record, Mindbody), custom development (bespoke experience). Choose based on: services (Botox vs lasers vs comprehensive), pricing ($200 vs $2000+ treatments), team size. Most successful medical spa websites: credentials prominent (medical director, RN, estheticians), before/after gallery stunning, testimonials with results, treatment menu with pricing, consultation booking easy, luxury aesthetic throughout.

MEDICAL SPA WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
CREDENTIALS + BEFORE/AFTER + RESULTS = CLIENTS

Medical spa websites succeed through: credentials prominent (medical director MD, RN injectors, certified laser technicians), before/after gallery stunning (interactive sliders, 100+ treatments), testimonials with results ("10 years off my face"), treatment menu with pricing (Botox $12/unit, fillers $600+), consultation booking easy (complimentary consult), luxury aesthetic throughout (premium feel). Most medical spa website mistakes: weak credentials (safety concerns), no before/after (can't see results), hidden pricing (frustration), no testimonials (no proof). Best practice: credentials prominent, before/after massive, pricing clear, testimonials visible.

ATTRACTING MEDICAL SPA CLIENTS

CREDENTIALS PROMINENT = SAFETY

Medical director MD, RN injectors

Display credentials prominently: medical director (board-certified MD, specialty), injectors (RN, NP, PA with certifications), laser technicians (certified, trained). Medical spa treatments = medical proceduresâ€”no credentials visible = safety concerns. Medical credentials establish trust.

Real example: Medspa had generic "aesthetic services" text (no credentials). Low client interest, many safety questions. Added credentials: "Medical Director Dr. Smith MD Board-Certified Dermatologist, RN Injectors Certified by Allergan, Laser Technicians CME Trained". Consultation bookings increased 200% (safety established).

BEFORE/AFTER GALLERY STUNNING = RESULTS PROOF

Interactive sliders, 100+ treatments

Before/after gallery quality drives consultations: interactive sliders (drag to see transformation), treatment diversity (Botox, fillers, lasers, facials), quantity (100+ real treatments). No before/after or weak photos = no proof of capability. Clients book based on visible results.

Real example: Medspa had generic stock photos (not actual results). Low consultation rate. Added real before/after gallery: 100+ treatments with interactive sliders (Botox before/after, lip filler transformation, laser skin resurfacing). Consultation bookings increased 280% (results proven), average treatment value increased 60%.

TREATMENT MENU WITH PRICING = TRANSPARENCY

Botox $12/unit, fillers $600+

Publish treatment menu with pricing: injectables (Botox $12/unit, Dysport $10/unit, fillers $600-800/syringe), lasers (fractional CO2 $800, IPL $300), facials (hydrafacial $150). Transparent pricing filters qualified prospects, attracts serious clients. Hidden pricing wastes time on consultations.

Real example: Medspa required consultations for pricing (no rates visible). Price-shopping clients wasted 15+ hours/week. Added treatment menu: "Botox $12/unit, Lip Filler $600, Full Face Syringes $2400+". Wrong-fit consultations decreased 75%, right-fit bookings increased 120%, saved 12 hours/week.

TESTIMONIALS WITH RESULTS = EMOTIONAL PROOF

"10 years off my face"

Display testimonials with specific results: "Lip flip looked so natural, friends asked if I lost weight", "Botox: 10 years off my face, still expressive", "Laser resurfacing: acne scars gone, confidence back". Generic "great medspa" testimonials = no emotional proof. Specific results inspire bookings.

Real example: Medspa had generic testimonials ("professional, beautiful spa"). Low emotional connection. Added specific results: "Lip filler: nervous about overfilling, nurse was so conservative and artistic, looked so natural my husband noticed something different but couldn't tell what". Conversion rate increased 150% (natural results resonated).
